facilities.name: Patricia Glinton-Meicholas Performance Hall
facilities.description: Our main performance venue featuring state-of-the-art acoustics and professional lighting systems.
facilities.longDescription: Named after our founder, this 300-seat performance hall is the centerpiece of our campus. The hall features professional-grade acoustics designed specifically for both intimate performances and full productions. The space includes a full fly system, orchestra pit, and advanced lighting and sound equipment used by professional theaters worldwide.
features: Professional lighting console and LED system
Full fly system for theatrical productions
facilities.usage: Student performances, faculty concerts, community events, visiting artists

facilities.name: Caribbean Movement Studios
facilities.description: Three professional dance studios with sprung floors, mirrors, and audio systems for all styles of dance training.
facilities.longDescription: Our dance facility consists of three professional studios designed for different styles of movement training. Each studio features specialized flooring systems to prevent injury and enhance performance. The studios are equipped with professional audio systems, full-wall mirrors, and climate control for optimal training conditions.
features: Individual sound systems with wireless microphones
facilities.usage: Dance classes, rehearsals, movement workshops, fitness programs

facilities.name: Marcus Williams Recording Studios
facilities.description: Professional recording and production facility with industry-standard equipment and acoustically treated rooms.
facilities.longDescription: Our recording studio complex provides students with access to professional-grade recording equipment and production facilities. The studio is designed to accommodate everything from solo vocal recordings to full ensemble sessions, with specialized equipment for capturing traditional Caribbean instruments.
features: Main recording room with isolation booths
Control room with Pro Tools HDX system
Collection of vintage and modern microphones
MIDI and electronic music production suite
facilities.usage: Student recordings, faculty projects, local artist collaborations

facilities.name: Antonius Roberts Visual Arts Complex
facilities.description: Comprehensive visual arts facilities including painting, sculpture, digital media, and traditional craft studios.
facilities.longDescription: Our visual arts complex provides dedicated spaces for all forms of artistic expression. The facility includes traditional art studios as well as cutting-edge digital media labs, allowing students to explore both classical techniques and contemporary digital art forms.
features: Painting and drawing studios with natural lighting
Sculpture workshop with clay and metal working areas
Digital media lab with graphics workstations
Traditional craft workshop for Bahamian arts
facilities.usage: Art classes, independent projects, community workshops, exhibitions

facilities.name: Sarah Thompson Technology Center
facilities.description: Modern computer labs and innovation spaces equipped with the latest software and hardware for creative technology projects.
facilities.longDescription: The Technology Center houses our computer science and digital media programs. The facility includes multiple computer labs, a maker space with 3D printers and electronics equipment, and collaborative spaces designed for innovative project work.
features: Maker space with 3D printers and laser cutters
VR/AR development lab with headsets and sensors
facilities.usage: Computer science classes, digital media projects, innovation workshops

facilities.name: Elena Rodriguez Marine Research Lab
facilities.description: Specialized laboratory for marine biology research with aquarium systems and field research equipment.
facilities.longDescription: Our marine research laboratory provides students with hands-on experience in marine biology and environmental science. The lab includes live specimen tanks, research equipment, and direct access to marine environments for field work.
features: Saltwater aquarium systems for live specimens
Field research boat and diving equipment
facilities.usage: Marine biology research, environmental studies, community education

facilities.name: CAPAS Cultural Heritage Library
facilities.description: Comprehensive library with extensive collections of Caribbean literature, music, and cultural resources.
facilities.longDescription: Our library serves as both an academic resource and cultural repository. The collection includes rare books on Caribbean history, extensive music archives, and digital resources for research and creative projects.
features: Caribbean music and oral history archives
facilities.usage: Research, study, cultural preservation, community access

facilities.name: CAPAS Student Life Center
facilities.description: Central hub for student activities including dining, recreation, and social gathering spaces.
facilities.longDescription: The Student Life Center serves as the social heart of our campus. This facility includes dining options featuring local cuisine, recreational spaces, and areas for student organizations and informal gatherings.
features: Cafeteria with local and international cuisine
facilities.usage: Dining, socializing, student activities, campus events
